subject: Marketing
title: One Idea Per Sentence
description: One-minute skill: One Idea Per Sentence.

hook.text: Hemingway won the Nobel Prize writing short sentences. Copywriters should follow his lead.

buildup.text: Long sentences with multiple clauses force readers to hold too many ideas in working memory.

discovery.text: Each sentence should deliver one thought. That thought should lead to the next.

twist.text: Short sentences create rhythm and momentum. Long sentences create confusion and fatigue.

climax.text: The discipline of one idea per sentence forces clarity that readers can feel immediately.

punchline.text: Short sentences move readers forward. Fast.

quiz.question: Why should copywriters limit each sentence to one idea?
options: It prevents working memory overload and creates momentum
Search engines penalize sentences with multiple ideas
Readers skip every other sentence on average
